I am creating a combustor model in C++ using reservoir, reactor and 
flow d=
evice elements. I have started by following the example given in 
the Cante=
ra pdf file. It consists of air, fuel and igniter reservoirs, 
mass flow co=
ntroller, combustor, valve (to regulate the pressure) and 
exhaust reservoi=
r that are brought together in the reactor network. 
But I don't quiet unde=
rstand why it is necessary to use valve 
controller to regulate the pressur=
e after the reactor and before tha 
exhaust reservoir; because in the CSTR =
the pressure supposed to be 
constant. Another issue I am dealing with is t=
he valve itself. The 
total massflow rate going trough the valve at the exh=
aust is not the 
same as the one going into the combustor and also there is=
 a time lag 
between tha peak massflow rates at two mentioned stations.Is i=
t 
because of closed loop controller properties (like tolerance or gain 
or=
 ...)and if that is the case is there any way to fix it?
Any answer or comm=
ent is greately appreciated.
